placeholder

To Governor
Title
Consumer Protection Online Products and Services Data of Children (Maryland Kids Code)
Sponsored by
Senators Kramer, Hester, and West
Status
Approved by the Governor - Chapter 460
Analysis
Fiscal and Policy Note (Revised)
Attorney General's Review Letter
Synopsis
Requiring a covered entity that offers an online product reasonably likely to be accessed by children to complete a certain data protection impact assessment on or before April 1, 2026, under certain circumstances; requiring certain privacy protections for certain online products; prohibiting certain data collection and sharing practices; authorizing certain monitoring practices to allow a child's parent or guardian to monitor the child's online activity or location without providing an obvious signal to the child; etc.

Bill File Type: Regular
Effective Date(s): October 1, 2024

    Open Legislative Data Download
    You are about to download a "comma-separated values" (CSV) file and/or a JSON file.
    The file includes information such as number, sponsor, title, legislative status, synopsis, committee assignments, legislative history, hearing dates, etc for each piece of legislation introduced during the selected legislative session.
    A word about the file format: CSV and JSON files are common file formats, widely supported by consumer and business applications and is used to move data between programs. The file you download can be imported into Excel, a text editor, browser, or any other application that supports the CSV and JSON formats. To save, right-click button and save as desired file format.

readabilityObject.title: Legislation - SB0571
readabilityObject.content:
Synopsis

Requiring a covered entity that offers an online product reasonably likely to be accessed by children to complete a certain data protection impact assessment on or before April 1, 2026, under certain circumstances; requiring certain privacy protections for certain online products; prohibiting certain data collection and sharing practices; authorizing certain monitoring practices to allow a child's parent or guardian to monitor the child's online activity or location without providing an obvious signal to the child; etc.

Details

Introduced in a prior session as: SB0844 Session: 2023 Regular Session

Effective Date(s): October 1, 2024

(   13-301,   14-4601 through 14-4612 )
readabilityObject.textContent:
Synopsis
                                Requiring a covered entity that offers an online product reasonably likely to be accessed by children to complete a certain data protection impact assessment on or before April 1, 2026, under certain circumstances; requiring certain privacy protections for certain online products; prohibiting certain data collection and sharing practices; authorizing certain monitoring practices to allow a child's parent or guardian to monitor the child's online activity or location without providing an obvious signal to the child; etc.
                            
                            
                                
                            
                                Details
                                

                                        
                                        
                                                
Introduced in a prior session as: SB0844 Session: 2023 Regular Session
